solution_line_template: Since Ms. Cole's sixth-level math class has {students_sixth_level} students and four times as many students in her fourth-level class, there are {multiplier_fourth_level}*{students_sixth_level} = <<{multiplier_fourth_level}*{students_sixth_level}={students_fourth_level}>>{students_fourth_level} in her fourth-level math class.

For the two levels, Ms. Cole teaches math to {students_fourth_level}+{students_sixth_level} = <<{students_fourth_level}+{students_sixth_level}={students_fourth_and_sixth_level}>>{students_fourth_and_sixth_level} students.

If the number of students in her seventh-level math class is twice that in the fourth-level math class, then she teaches {multiplier_seventh_level}*{students_fourth_level} = <<{multiplier_seventh_level}*{students_fourth_level}={students_seventh_level}>>{students_seventh_level} students in the seventh-level math class.

Ms. Cole teaches {students_seventh_level}+{students_fourth_and_sixth_level} = <<{students_seventh_level}+{students_fourth_and_sixth_level}={total_students}>>{total_students} math students in the school.
